description: {"blocks":[{"key":"f0qh9","text":"This protocol describes isolation of nuclei from frozen tissue using dounce homogenization, iodixanol gradient centrifugation, and FANS. Nuclei are permeabilized, washed, and counted; single-nucleus suspensions of sufficient concentration and nuclei quality may then be processed using the Chromium Next GEM Single Cell Multiome ATAC + Gene Expression (CG000338, Rev F) protocol from 10X Genomics.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

documents.ofn: Nuclei Preparation from Frozen Tissue for 10X Multiome using Dounce Homogenization, Iodixanol Gradient Centrifugation, and FANS, v1.2, Jan 2024.pdf

groups.title: Cellular Senescence Network (SenNet) Method Development Community
SenNet TMC-University of California San Diego

{"blocks":[{"key":"deuh2","text":"Pre-chill a large, swing-bucket tabletop centrifuge to 4°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ulo7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7h7uj","text":"Retrieve a 1 mL dounce homogenizer with 2 pestles (“Loose” and “Tight”) for each sample. Place on ice and allow to chill.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"79r0j","text":"Add 1 mL of NIM-DP-L buffer to each dounce homogenizer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ej6kt","text":"**If tissue mass is very small (\u003c 50 mg), instead add 600 µL of NIM-DP-L.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":72}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8sj74","text":"Transfer each sample to a dounce homogenizer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"34t5b","text":"Using the loose pestle, gently homogenize the sample until most of the tissue has broken into small pieces (usually 5-10 strokes). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f60of","text":"Switch to the tight pestle and homogenize until the solution is uniform with no obvious particles (usually 15-25 strokes). Be gentle and avoid introducing bubbles. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bminc","text":"Transfer the full volume of homogenized sample to a 30 μm filter in a 1.5 mL Eppendorf Lobind tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7fco2","text":"Rinse each dounce with 1 mL of NIM-DP buffer and transfer the rinse to the filter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7cc1r","text":"Centrifuge for 10 mins at 1000 rcf, 4°C, and 3/3 acceleration/deceleration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1htii","text":"**If tissue mass is very small (\u003c 50 mg), skip steps 10-11**","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":41},{"style":"bold","offset":42,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bdubq","text":"Discard the supernatant and resuspend the pellet in 1 mL of NIM-DP.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a55b8","text":"Centrifuge for 10 mins at 1000 rcf, 4°C, and 3/3 acceleration/deceleration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"350uj","text":"Discard the supernatant and resuspend the pelleted nuclei in 2 mL of 20% iodixanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bas3n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b0bh0","text":"Centrifuge for 30 mins at 4000 rcf, 4C, and 3/1 acceleration/deceleration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":44,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15are","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"chiaa","text":"**If tissue mass is very small (\u003c 50 mg), instead resuspend in 400 uL of 50% iodixanol (for a final iodixanol concentration of 20%).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":132}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"120ve","text":"Slowly pipette the suspension dropwise onto a 500 µL cushion of 25% iodixanol in a 5 mL Eppendorf Lobind tube. **Do not mix this solution once transferred.**","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":111,"length":31},{"style":"bold","offset":143,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7cal8","text":"Discard the supernatant, leaving a small volume (\u003c 20 µL) to avoid disturbing the pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6f75r","text":"Resuspend the pellet in 500 µL of sort buffer and incubate on ice for 10 mins, protected from light.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bbl30","text":"Sort 120,000-130,000 nuclei into a 1.5 mL Eppendorf Lobind tube containing 90 μL of collection buffer using a Sony SH800 Cell Sorter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1da4t","text":"Centrifuge the sorted nuclei for 5 mins at 500 rcf, 4°C, and 3/3 acceleration/deceleration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"da5m0","text":"Discard the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ber7","text":"Resuspend the pellet in 100 μL of NPB. Incubate on ice for 1 minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f2rt1","text":"Add 900 μL of wash buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"56ku0","text":"Centrifuge for 5 mins at 500 rcf, 4°C, and 3/3 acceleration/deceleration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2sdfh","text":"Carefully remove the supernatant, leaving 10-15 μL to avoid disturbing the pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8o0s1","text":"Gently resuspend in 12 μL of 1X Nuclei Buffer (prepared from 10X Genomics Multiome protocol).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"964d0","text":"Stain an aliquot of nuclei with 0.4% Trypan Blue. Load 10 μL into one chamber of a hemocytometer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"brp9t","text":"Count nuclei in four quadrants. Average the count and determine the nuclei concentration (nuclei/μL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2k4io","text":"Capture images from the microscope field at 10X and 20X magnification. Assess nuclei quality.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"afnkv","text":"Follow the 10X Genomics protocol “Chromium Next GEM Single Cell Multiome ATAC + Gene Expression” (CG000338, Rev F) for the remainder of the experiment. Input 18,000 nuclei for each tagmentation reaction for a targeted recovery of ~10,000 nuclei.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":33,"length":81}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Nuclei Preparation from Frozen Tissue for 10X Multiome using Dounce Homogenization, Iodixanol Gradient Centrifugation, and FANS (v1.2, Jan 2024)
